subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... Yes. ... It all comes from the *final* proposal.  However, the initial proposal need not be complete about these points. -- While staying with the Asonu, I
messageBody:
jeromeshorowitz scripsit:

> Does a Unicode proposal designate which characters are letters?

Yes.

> The Python library refers to "the Unicode Character Database which
> defines character properties for all Unicode characters" as the source
> for the Python library routines to return information about the
> characters. Does any of this come from the proposal?

It all comes from the *final* proposal. However, the initial proposal
need not be complete about these points.

--
While staying with the Asonu, I met a man from John Cowan
the Candensian plane, which is very much like cowan@...
ours, only more of it consists of Toronto. http://:www.ccil.org/~cowan
--Ursula K. Le Guin, Changing Planes

jeromeshorowitz scripsit:

> Does a Unicode proposal designate which characters are letters?  

Yes.

> The Python library refers to "the Unicode Character Database which
> defines character properties for all Unicode characters" as the source
> for the Python library routines to return information about the
> characters.  Does any of this come from the proposal?    

It all comes from the *final* proposal.  However, the initial proposal
need not be complete about these points.
